entry.title: When I Am Young and Beautiful
entry.summary:
Author: wordswillwrite

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 15,619Chapters: 5/?Kudos: 14

Summary: Clara Kent flinched and tried to block the noise around her. She felt surreal sitting here, at the funeral of Bruce Wayne, and she felt alone, so very alone. Or, Bruce Wayne, the most dramatic man she knows, dies quietly one afternoon in his Manor. Clara is left to pick up the pieces.

entry.title: Eden
entry.summary:
Author: MoonlitMiffy

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,419Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 13

Summary: This was the night a man with nothing to lose became a man with a family waiting for him at home.It was the moment Bruce Wayne decided that he had to be better than Batman.If it got Dick to smile that wonderful smile of his.If it brought a little more light into Jason’s eyes.If it helped ease the tension trapped in Tim’s shoulders.If it erased the crease from Damian’s brow as he slept.Then Bruce Wayne could defuse a bomb, save the city, and make enough time to help his boys get ready for bed.

entry.title: Devour Me
entry.summary:
Author: TPWK28HS

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 15,209Chapters: 7/?Kudos: 59

Summary: That night, Bruce Wayne didn’t just lose his parents… he also lost the ability to taste anything. He awakened as a Folk: nothing fills him, nothing can satisfy the emptiness inside. The Joker takes every chance to tempt him, but his flavor, though intense, is so cloying and nauseating that it pushes Bruce to the edge, making him hate Cakes. Until he tastes him.Clark Kent. A reporter who, by accident, reveals himself to be a Cake. But not just any Cake: to Bruce, he’s addictive, igniting him instantly and leaving him with a single desire… to devour him again. Clark promises to keep the secret, but he runs. Bruce won’t allow it. From that moment on, Kent becomes his obsession. Yet Clark, despite all his empathy, hides an even greater secret: he must conceal that he is Superman. He tries to escape this dangerous game, but when his family’s farm is at risk, Bruce offers him a deal he can’t refuse: save it… in exchange for becoming his sustenance. A convenient arrangement… or the beginning of a bond that will devour everything?

entry.title: Displaced
entry.summary:
Author: ClarkKents_Biceps

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 116,838Chapters: 20/20Kudos: 197

Summary: - The story where a bit of time-travelling mishaps happen and make life very complicated for Superbat - Chaos. Pure chaos. Downtown Gotham City had gone to hell. The place was an absolute mess — in fact, calling it a mess was an understatement. Gotham shimmered like it had gone mad: cars levitated inches too high; graffiti shifted when no one looked; even the shadows seemed to dance. Chaos grinned in every windowpane. And behind it lurked an interdimensional imp — a creature with obscene power, far too much for anyone’s good — spreading madness as a result of trying to fanboy over his favourite hero. Every spark of chaos was one of his well-meant ideas let loose. “Nightwing!” Tim barked at his comms eyes locked on Gotham — alive, wild, awake. It was wrong, The city wasn’t supposed to move like this.

entry.title: Sun Starved
entry.summary:
Author: Fish_stik

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 36,864Chapters: 7/?Kudos: 68

Summary: Bruce had just been patrolling one night. That's all. Nothing world-ending (not that Alfred knew about his nightly ventures—which itself might be Bruce-ending), and yet here he was. Dragged to some backwater summer camp for "half-bloods" by a young woman after helping her fight off some weird meta thug, where everyone took Ancient Greek myths far too seriously. Don't get him wrong, he loved those stories; he basically grew up on them, but there was no way that this was all real.   Like, come on... A half-horse activities director? Magical strawberry fields? It was all too much, and that was coming from the guy from a city overrun with metas and who lived right next door to the place with an alien as its hero. Though Bruce didn't know or even trust the guy (?), Superman made far more sense than these demigods.  Bruce fights a minotaur with Diana and gets dragged to Camp Half-Blood, where he then finds out he’s a demigod, makes a very attractive friend, and finds out the sun has been stolen. What a killer summer…

entry.title: tying me to you
entry.summary:
Author: Areiton

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 21,944Chapters: 16/24Kudos: 79

Summary: It was a gauntlet, getting here, and now that he is--now that there is nothing to do but watch the vows being said and the Families reacting, now he can second guess himself. It's done. Right or wrong, the decision is made. Peter has a husband, bound to him by magic and blood and, in a few minutes, law. He takes a deep breath and for the first time in a very long time, he considers praying.

entry.title: Last Christmas
entry.summary:
Author: Caffinated_ghost

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 8,432Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 77

Summary: Last Christmas, Bruce Wayne tried to confess his love for reporter Clark Kent, but Clark Kent rejected him, leaving Bruce with bitter feelings for the season.This year, Clark Kent is alone for Christmas for the first time in his life. He doesn't know what to do with himself, so he takes up a shift for monitor duty at the Watchtower, but it's not until he accidently walks in on Batman with his cowl off does he know who he's spending the next eight hours with. Now's he's stuck with the guy he rejected on Christmas Eve with a world to watch over.

entry.title: Sick of All These People Talking
entry.summary:
Author: CatCantRead

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 23,613Chapters: 16/16Kudos: 338

Summary: Title from: Castle by: Halsey When Dick confides in Clark about Bruce’s dangerous overindulgence in his “Brucie Wayne” persona. A casual lunch spirals wildly out of control. Mistaken for Clark’s son, Dick accidentally sparks a media frenzy that assumes Bruce Wayne and Clark Kent are secretly married. Bruce decides to use the cover story to his advantage, dropping the Playboy mask and slipping closer to an arms dealer supplying Gotham’s elite. But the deeper he digs, the more dangerous the game becomes. The mission takes a devastating and unexpected turn. In the aftermath, with secrets exposed and lives on the line, Bruce and Clark are forced to confront what’s really been growing between them all along.
